title: Karl Stefanovic stands awkwardly with his 60 Minutes colleagues at Nine's Upfronts
text:
Karl Stefanovic looked jubilant at the Channel Nine Upfronts on Wednesday night.

But despite his happy demeanor, the former Today show host had a slightly awkward moment while posing for photos alongside his network colleagues.

The 45-year-old looked rather aloof as he stood to the side of the group.

End of the line: Karl Stefanovic (far left) had a slightly awkward moment at the Channel Nine Upfronts on Wednesday as he posed alongside his 60 Minutes colleagues

For several moments, 60 Minutes reporter Charles Wooley turned his back to Karl so he could chat to Liz Hayes.

But despite being a little left out, Karl was smiling from ear to ear and looked proud to be included in the group photo.

Channel Nine announced its 2020 lineup, including ratings winners like Married At First Sight and The Block, at the Upfronts event.

What's going on here? For several moments, 60 Minutes reporter Charles Wooley (second from left) turned his back to Karl so he could chat to Liz Hayes

But Karl's show This Time Next Year, which finished its second season in September, was noticeably absent from the schedule.

The program was a ratings failure, reaching an all-time low of just 395,000 metro viewers last month.

The penultimate episode marked a low point for the series and a loss of around 300,000 viewers since the premiere.

Much better! Charles eventually turned to acknowledge Karl, who seemed to be in good spirits

By contrast, the first season of This Time Next Year had been a ratings success for Nine in 2017, averaging around 800,000 metro viewers per episode.

Karl currently works as a contributing reporter on 60 Minutes.

He was sacked as host of the Today show on December 19 after months of dwindling ratings that Nine executives had blamed on his tumultuous personal life.
description: Karl Stefanovic looked jubilant at the Channel Nine Upfronts on Wednesday night.
